metadata.title: CVE-2022-46884 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A potential use-after-free vulnerability existed in SVG Images if theRefresh Driver was destroyed at an inopportune time. This could have leadto memory corruption or a potentially exploitable crash. *Note*: Thisadvisory was added on December 13th, 2022 after discovering it wasinadvertently left out of the original advisory. The fix was included inthe original release of Firefox 106. This vulnerability affects Firefox <106.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
